TopicTitle: 1x-100x timewarp causes increased skin temp until explosion

Articles.Content:
If you timewarp past 100x, skin temp instantly goes down (because the physics calculation for heat radiation gets disabled probably), but if stay at 100x, it accumulates heat until explosion because of Kerbol radiation. If you disable radiation in physics, the problem goes away. If you set radiation to 0.1 instead of 1, the effect is doable. The larger the surface of the part, the larger is the heat accumulation through radiation. It happens in all parts (mod parts and squad parts).

Happens in 32-bits and 64-bit community fix.

MODS (visual mods are disabled if I'm testing 64-bit):

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-03T16:31:11Z" title="07/03/2015 04:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 3, 2015</time> by includao**

SOLUTION: I tracked the problem back to Ferram "FAR" Aerodynamics. I've deleted the folder of the lastest version and downloaded the same version again. It's seems to be working perfectly now. Reproducing the problems and tracking it mod by mod is a tiresome process, but I wish I had done it sooner instead of smashing my head against the wall for almost 3 days.
